definitions: To cause (an event or situation, typically one that is bad or undesirable) to happen suddenly, unexpectedly, or prematurely.
To cause to move with great haste or impulsiveness.
To cause a substance to be deposited in solid form from a solution.
To fall vertically, steeply, or quickly.
examples: The crisis was precipitated by a sudden drop in oil prices.
He precipitated himself into the argument without thinking.
Adding the reagent will precipitate the salt.
Rain began to precipitate from the dark clouds.
